text: RT @amandamull: I wrote about how nothing is going to stop Christmas shopping, and nothing ever has. Extravagant consumption has been a part of the holiday since Saturnalia, and FDR moved up Thanksgiving during the Great Depression to make sure people shopped enough. https://t.co/GpwuQX3YnY

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week's "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose parents have forbidden him from telling his younger brother that he's gay. https://t.co/cCtXUCJTU4

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's loss, @noUpside writes, "has precipitated a deep rift in the right-wing information ecosystem." Media outlets, tech platforms, and commentators have had to choose between upholding reality and pretending that the president really won. https://t.co/rpbe5M3Av7

name: TheAtlantic
text: Building a new administration in the span of 11 weeks is a tall order in normal times. But Joe Biden has the added challenge of doing almost all of it virtually, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/Jy40krlHnd

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: Christmas shopping exists as we know it in America because urban elites were scandalized by the indulgent celebrations of the working class and business owners wanted to limit their drunken revelry so they could get back to work. https://t.co/GpwuQX3YnY

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: A crucial bit of research that might draw attention among originalists on the Court: The Constitution says a president can “grant” pardons—but in the 18th century, “grant” only meant giving to someone else, not yourself: https://t.co/vbu41iNxa2
